Name: go
Concepticon_Definition: To move from a place to another that is further away.
Example_Context: I saw him on the road. I don't know where he was going.

Name: seed
Concepticon_Definition: A mature fertilized plant ovule, consisting of an embryo and its food store surrounded by a protective seed coat (testa).
Example_Context: You can eat the seeds of (insert name of local fruit).

Name: push
Concepticon_Definition: To apply a force to (an object), in order that it moves away from the origin of the force that was applied.
Example_Context: He was pushing and pulling the furniture around the room.

Name: narrow
Description: Of a gap, opposite of 'wide'.  *Not* of an object, *not* opposite of 'broad, thick'.
Concepticon_Definition: Having a small width.
Example_Context: The canyon is wide here, but further down it's narrow.

Name: stand
Description: Stative verb, 'be standing', *not* change of state 'get up, stand up'.
Concepticon_Definition: To be upright in an erect position, supported by the feet.
Example_Context: He is standing over there.

Name: say
Concepticon_Definition: To communicate orally, using a particular language; to express in words.
Example_Context: She said that she would be late.

Name: wash
Concepticon_Definition: To remove dirt and grime from an object, using water (usually with soap).
Example_Context: She washed her hands.

Name: turn
Concepticon_Definition: To change direction of movement.
Example_Context: It was heavy so it was hard to turn it.

Name: take
Concepticon_Definition: To grasp with the hands.
Example_Context: Take the money when you go.

Name: thick
Concepticon_Definition: Relatively large distance from one surface to the opposite in its smallest solid dimension.
Example_Context: That tree trunk is thick; it would take a long time cut through.

Name: wet
Concepticon_Definition: Covered with or impregnated with liquid.
Example_Context: Is it wet or dry?

Name: wide
Description: Of a gap, opposite of 'narrow'.  *Not* of an object, *not* opposite of 'thick'.
Concepticon_Definition: Having a long distance or area between two points, especially horizontally.
Example_Context: The canyon is wide here, but further down it's narrow.

Name: leg
Concepticon_Definition: The limb of an animal (including humans) that extends from the groin to the ankle.
Example_Context: He fell and broke his leg.

Name: carry
Concepticon_Definition: To lift and bring to somewhere else; to transport by lifting.
Example_Context: She carried her bag [under her arm].

Name: fly_N
Description: The noun for the insect '(a) fly'..
Concepticon_Definition: A common insect; any species of insect of the order Diptera.
Example_Context: He killed a fly.

Name: bitter
Concepticon_Definition: Having an acrid taste.
Example_Context: The leaves tasted bitter.

Name: wing
Concepticon_Definition: The appendage of an animal's (bird, bat, insect) body that enables it to fly in the air.
Example_Context: Birds have wings; people do not.

Name: worm
Concepticon_Definition: A generally tubular invertebrate of the annelid phylum.
Example_Context: There is a worm in this (insert name of local fruit).

Name: sand
Concepticon_Definition: A loose material consisting of small mineral particles, or rock and mineral particles, distinguishable by the naked eye; grains vary from almost spherical to angular, with a diameter range from 1/16 to 2 millimeters.
Example_Context: She let the sand fall through her hands.

Name: throw
Concepticon_Definition: To cause (an object) to move rapidly through the air, with the force of the hand or arm.
Example_Context: He threw a stick into the water.

Name: swell
Concepticon_Definition: To grow larger in volume.
Example_Context: His arm swelled after he was injured.

Name: stick
Description: The noun '(a) stick' (e.g. of wood), not the verb for to adhere.,
Concepticon_Definition: A long, thin piece of wood, mainly left in the shape in which it grew, that does not bend.
Example_Context: He carried a stick under his arm.

Name: snake
Concepticon_Definition: Any reptile of the suborder Serpentes, typically having a scaly cylindrical limbless body, fused eyelids, and a jaw modified for swallowing large prey.
Example_Context: He jumped when he saw the snake.

Name: smoke
Concepticon_Definition: An aerosol, consisting of visible particles and gases, produced by the incomplete burning of carbon-based materials, such as wood and fossil fuels.
Example_Context: I could see the smoke from the fire.

Name: stone
Concepticon_Definition: A general term for rock that is used in construction, either crushed for use as aggregate or cut into shaped blocks as dimension stone.
Example_Context: He held the stone in his hand

Name: three
Concepticon_Definition: The third natural number (3).
Example_Context: Three plus one is four.

Name: two
Concepticon_Definition: The cardinal number occurring after one and before three, represented in Roman numerals as II and in Arabic numerals as 2.
Example_Context: One plus one is two.

Name: smell
Description: Verb for a person *perceiving* an odour.  *Not* emit a odour (intransitive).
Concepticon_Definition: To perceive the presence of molecules in the air by inhaling them through the nose.
Example_Context: I (can) smell smoke.

Name: forest
Concepticon_Definition: A vegetation community dominated by trees and other woody shrubs, growing close enough together that the tree tops touch or overlap, creating various degrees of shade on the forest floor.
Example_Context: There are many animals in the forest.

Name: snow
Concepticon_Definition: The most common form of frozen precipitation, usually flakes or starlike crystals, matted ice needles, or combinations, and often rime-coated.
Example_Context: There was snow on the ground.

Name: round
Concepticon_Definition: Circular or having a circular cross-section in at least one direction.
Example_Context: That table is round.

Name: sweet
Concepticon_Definition: Having the taste characteristic of sugar or honey.
Example_Context: This apple is ripe now, it tastes sweet.

Name: hard
Concepticon_Definition: Resistant to pressure.
Example_Context: It was very hard. When he bit it he broke his tooth.

Name: neck
Concepticon_Definition: The part of the body (found in some animals, including humans) that connects the head and the trunk.
Example_Context: He put his hand on his neck.

Name: straight
Concepticon_Definition: Not crooked or bent; having a constant direction throughout its length.
Example_Context: This stick is straight, but that one is bent.

Name: grind
Concepticon_Definition: To break something into small pieces by pressing it flat, or grinding it to powder.
Example_Context: He’s grinding flour.

Name: wind
Description: The noun '(a) wind', /wind/, not the verb /waind/.
Concepticon_Definition: The motion of air relative to the earth's surface; usually means horizontal air motion, as distinguished from vertical motion.
Example_Context: She felt the wind in her face.

Name: year
Concepticon_Definition: The time it takes the Earth to complete one revolution of the Sun (between 365.24 and 365.26 days depending on the point of reference).
Example_Context: The year is almost over.

Name: sew
Concepticon_Definition: To pass thread repeatedly through fabric or a material, using a needle, in order to join two or more parts or to make a pattern or motif.
Example_Context: He sewed the two pieces of cloth together.

Name: do
Concepticon_Definition: To act, to behave.
Example_Context: What did you **do** in the village yesterday?

Name: ant
Concepticon_Definition: Any of the black, red, brown, or yellow insects of the family Formicidae characterized by a large head and by living in organized colonies.
Example_Context: There's an ant climbing up your leg.

Name: one
Concepticon_Definition: The cardinal number that directly follows zero and precedes two, represented in Roman numerals as I, and in Arabic numerals as 1.
Example_Context: One plus one is two.

Name: near
Concepticon_Definition: Not far distant in time or space or degree or circumstances.
Example_Context: You can walk there in one day; it's near.

Name: play
Description: Transitive verb, 'playing' a game for amusement.  *Not* 'playing' a musical instrument.
Concepticon_Definition: To act in a manner such that one has fun; to engage in playful activities expressly for the purpose of recreation.
Example_Context: They’re playing a game outside.

Name: pull
Concepticon_Definition: To apply a force to (an object), in order that it moves towards the origin of the force that was applied.
Example_Context: He was pushing and pulling the furniture around the room.

Name: sleep
Concepticon_Definition: To rest in a state of decreased consciousness and reduced metabolism.
Example_Context: He is sleeping in the house.

Name: sky
Concepticon_Definition: The part of the earth's atmosphere and space outside it that is visible from earth's surface. During the day it is perceived as blue, and at night as black.
Example_Context: There were white clouds in the blue sky.

Name: night
Concepticon_Definition: The period between sunset and sunrise, when a location faces far away from the sun, thus when the sky is dark.
Example_Context: Night and day.

Name: left
Description: The opposite of 'right (hand side)'.  Ajdective, not adverb.
Concepticon_Definition: Something that is on the left side relative to another object.
Example_Context: He is blind in his left eye.

Name: new
Concepticon_Definition: Recently made, created or begun.
Example_Context: He lives in the new house; not in the old house.

Name: drink
Concepticon_Definition: To consume a liquid through the mouth.
Example_Context: He drank because he was thirsty.

Name: head
Concepticon_Definition: The part of the body of an animal or human which contains the brain, mouth and main sense organs.
Example_Context: He has lots of hair on his head.

Name: day
Concepticon_Definition: The period between sunrise and sunset where one enjoys daylight.
Example_Context: Day and night.

Name: hear
Concepticon_Definition: To perceive sound with the ear, without necessarily paying attention to it.
Example_Context: I heard a noise last night.

Name: hunt
Description: The verb '(to) hunt', not the noun '(a) hunt'.
Concepticon_Definition: To chase down prey and (usually) kill it.
Example_Context: He’s hunting animals in the forest.

Name: heavy
Concepticon_Definition: Of a physical object, having great weight.
Example_Context: The rock was very heavy.

Name: laugh
Concepticon_Definition: To express pleasure, mirth or derision by peculiar movement of the muscles of the face, particularly of the mouth, causing a lighting up of the face and eyes, and usually accompanied by the emission of explosive or chuckling sounds from the chest and throat.
Example_Context: When I saw him, he was laughing.

Name: dust
Concepticon_Definition: Any kind of solid material divided in particles of very small size.
Example_Context: When the ground is dry, you kick up dust when you walk.

Name: ice
Concepticon_Definition: The dense substance formed by the freezing of water to the solid state; it commonly occurs in the form of hexagonal crystals.
Example_Context: The ice is melting in the sun.

Name: ash
Description: The powdery remains of a fire, not the tree species 'ash'.
Concepticon_Definition: The incombustible matter remaining after a substance has been incinerated.
Example_Context: There was nothing left but ash.

Name: eat
Concepticon_Definition: To consume something solid or semi-solid (usually food) by putting it into the mouth and eventually swallowing it.
Example_Context: Eat some food and drink some water.

Name: die
Concepticon_Definition: To cease to live.
Example_Context: Everyone dies sooner or later.

Name: dry
Concepticon_Definition: (Almost) free from liquid or moisture.
Example_Context: Is it dry or wet?

Name: count
Concepticon_Definition: To enumerate the digits of one's numeral system.
Example_Context: I counted the stones; there were five stones.

Name: egg
Concepticon_Definition: Egg (either fertilized or not) from domesticated birds, most commonly hens, seen as food.
Example_Context: Don't drop the egg; it will break!

Name: fall
Concepticon_Definition: To descend in free fall due to the effect of gravity.
Example_Context: I fell from the tree yesterday and hurt my back.

Name: breathe
Concepticon_Definition: To repeatedly draw air into, and expel it from, the lungs, in order to extract oxygen from it and excrete waste products.
Example_Context: People can't breathe underwater.

Name: green
Concepticon_Definition: Having green as its colour; having the hue of that portion of the visible spectrum lying between yellow and blue, evoked in the human observer by radiant energy with wavelengths of approximately 490 to 570 nanometers.
Example_Context: The grass was fresh and green.

Name: far
Concepticon_Definition: Having a large intervening distance with regard to something.
Example_Context: You can't walk there in one day; it's too far.

Name: bad
Concepticon_Definition: Not good; unfavorable; negative.
Example_Context: That's a bad idea.

Name: lake
Concepticon_Definition: An enclosed body of water, usually but not necessarily fresh water, from which the sea is excluded.
Example_Context: Her house is beside the lake.

Name: dirty
Concepticon_Definition: Covered with or containing unpleasant substances such as dirt or grime.
Example_Context: This cup is clean and that one is dirty.

Name: know
Description: Know a fact, *not* a person.  Be aware of not be acquainted with.
Concepticon_Definition: To be certain or sure about something.
Example_Context: They know that we’re coming.

Name: fight
Concepticon_Definition: To be involved in a physical confrontation.
Example_Context: The two men are fighting outside.

Name: dig
Concepticon_Definition: To move earth, rocks, etc. out of the way, usually to create a hole.
Example_Context: He is digging in the ground.

Name: hide
Description: The verb 'to (hide)', not the noun for an animal skin.
Concepticon_Definition: To put something in a place where it will be harder to discover or out of sight.
Example_Context: They hid their food from the animals.

Name: shadow
Concepticon_Definition: Darkness, where light (particularly sunlight) is blocked.
Example_Context: He could see his shadow on the ground.

Name: fear
Concepticon_Definition: To be scared of; to have an uncontrollable emotion of anxiety about something that causes a scared reaction or frightening impression.
Example_Context: While the dog was here, I was scared.

Name: cloud
Concepticon_Definition: Suspensions of minute water droplets or ice crystals produced by the condensation of water vapour.
Example_Context: There were white clouds in the blue sky.

Name: vomit
Concepticon_Definition: To regurgitate the contents of the stomach.
Example_Context: He ate something bad and threw up (vomited).

Name: bone
Concepticon_Definition: Any of the components of an endoskeleton, consisting mainly of calcium phosphate, collagen and cells.
Example_Context: He fell and broke a bone.

Name: bite
Description: The verb '(to) bite', not the noun for '(a) bite'.
Concepticon_Definition: Clamping the teeth hard on something.
Example_Context: The dog bit him.

Name: house
Concepticon_Definition: The abode of a human being, their place of residence.
Example_Context: His house is at the edge of the village.

Name: navel
Concepticon_Definition: A scar where the umbilical cord was attached.
Example_Context: One could see his navel.

Name: yesterday
Concepticon_Definition: The day before today.
Example_Context: I haven't seen him today but I saw him yesterday.

Name: swim
Concepticon_Definition: To move through the water, without touching the bottom.
Example_Context: He is swimming in the lake.

Name: claw
Concepticon_Definition: A curved pointed appendage, found at the end of a toe or finger or, in arthropods, of the tarsus.
Example_Context: The cat scratched me with its claws.

Name: nail
Description: Nail of a finger/toe, not for hammering.
Concepticon_Definition: Hard keratin part growing at the end of a human's finger or toe.
Example_Context: He had very long nails on his fingers.

Name: fruit
Concepticon_Definition: A botanical fruit that can be eaten raw used as food
Example_Context: He picked fruit from the trees.

Name: full
Concepticon_Definition: Containing the most or maximum amount possible in the given available space.
Example_Context: An empty pot is easier to carry than a full pot. (WOLD)

Name: grass
Concepticon_Definition: A very large and widespread family of Monocotyledoneae, with more than 10.000 species, most of which are herbaceous, but a few are woody. The stems are jointed, the long, narrow leaves originating at the nodes. The flowers are inconspicuous, with a much reduced perianth, and are wind-pollinated or cleistogamous.
Example_Context: There is grass growing beside the river.

Name: fly_V
Description: The verb '(to) fly'.
Concepticon_Definition: To move autonomously through the air, without any part of the object or object's enclosure touching anything attached to the ground.
Example_Context: Birds can fly but people cannot.

Name: cry
Description: The sense of shedding tears, not shouting out.
Concepticon_Definition: To shed tears due to the impact of an emotion.
Example_Context: She was crying when I saw her.

Name: fire
Concepticon_Definition: The state of combustion in which inflammable material burns, producing heat, flames and often smoke.
Example_Context: He was cold, so he moved closer to the fire.

Name: four
Concepticon_Definition: The cardinal number occurring after three and before five, represented in Roman numerals as IV, in Arabic numerals as 4.
Example_Context: Four plus one is five.

Name: thigh
Concepticon_Definition: The area between the pelvis and buttocks and the knee.
Example_Context: He slapped his thigh.

Name: short
Concepticon_Definition: Small in length by comparison.
Example_Context: This is a short rope; that is a long rope.

Name: salt
Concepticon_Definition: A condiment (NaCl - Sodium Chloride) used to add to or enhance the flavour of food (commonly with pepper).
Example_Context: She puts too much salt in her food.

Name: fog
Concepticon_Definition: Water droplets or, rarely, ice crystals suspended in the air in sufficient concentration to reduce visibility appreciably.
Example_Context: I couldn't see the village because of the fog.

Name: chest
Description: The part of the body between shoulders and stomach.  *Not* specifically the female breast.
Concepticon_Definition: The portion of the body from the base of the neck to the top of the abdomen; the thorax.
Example_Context: His wore a medal on his chest.

Name: feather
Concepticon_Definition: A branching, hair-like structure that grows on the skin of birds and protects them against coldness and water and allows their wings to create lift.
Example_Context: What bird does this feather come from?

Name: freeze
Concepticon_Definition: To reach a chemically solid state, by the process of cooling.
Example_Context: When water freezes, it turns to ice.

Name: five
Concepticon_Definition: The fifth natural number (5).
Example_Context: Four plus one is five.

Name: give
Concepticon_Definition: To transfer the possession or holding (of an object) to another person.
Example_Context: She wanted to cut the (insert name of local fruit). He gave her a knife.

Name: fish
Concepticon_Definition: A cold-blooded vertebrate animal that lives in water that moves with the help of fins and breathes using gills (Pisces).
Example_Context: I can see a fish swimming in the water.

Name: sit
Description: Stative verb, 'be sitting', *not* change of state 'sit down'..
Concepticon_Definition: To be in a position with the upper body upright and the legs resting.
Example_Context: He is sitting over there.

Name: sharp
Concepticon_Definition: Having the ability to cut easily.
Example_Context: A sharp knife cuts better than a blunt one.

Name: sea
Concepticon_Definition: A body of salt water that is smaller than an ocean and generally in proximity to a continent.
Example_Context: Her house is beside the sea.

Name: sing
Concepticon_Definition: To produce harmonious sounds with one's voice.
Example_Context: I heard him yesterday. He was singing.

Name: see
Concepticon_Definition: To perceive [images] with the eye, without necessarily paying attention to them.
Example_Context: I see him every day on the road.

Name: big
Concepticon_Definition: Of a great size; the weakest sense of great size.
Example_Context: This is a big stone. That is a small stone.

Name: right
Description: Opposite of 'left'.  *Not* 'correct'.  Adjective form, not adverb.
Concepticon_Definition: Something that is on the right side relative to another object.
Example_Context: He is blind in his right eye.

Name: think
Description: Verb for the mental activity, process of thinking; the generic term for 'cogitate, be thinking abour something'.  *Not* have an opinion.
Concepticon_Definition: To actively and consciously use one's mental powers, usually to form ideas.
Example_Context: What are you doing?  I'm just thinking.

Name: rotten
Concepticon_Definition: Having changed its colour, smell or composition (partially or completely), due to being attacked and decomposed by microorganisms (relating to organic matter).
Example_Context: That fruit is rotten.

Name: flower
Description: The noun '(a) flower', to the verb 'bloom'.
Concepticon_Definition: The reproductive structure of angiosperm plants, consisting of stamens and carpels surrounded by petals and sepals all borne on the receptacle.
Example_Context: What type of flower is this?

Name: river
Concepticon_Definition: A stream of water which flows in a channel from high ground to low ground and ultimately to a lake or the sea, except in a desert area where it may dwindle away to nothing.
Example_Context: He lives beside the river.

Name: smooth
Concepticon_Definition: Not rough; having a surface texture that lacks friction.
Example_Context: He picked a smooth stone from the river.

Name: live
Description: Verb 'be alive'. *Not* 'dwell' in a place.
Concepticon_Definition: To be alive; to have a life.
Example_Context: How many years can people live for?

Name: kill
Concepticon_Definition: To put to death; to end a life.
Example_Context: They started fighting. He killed him.

Name: come
Concepticon_Definition: To move toward or to reach either the speaker, the person spoken to, or the subject of the speaker's narrative.
Example_Context: I saw him on the road. I don't know where he was coming from.

Name: old
Concepticon_Definition: Having lived or existed for a relatively long period of time.
Example_Context: He lives in the old house, not in the new house.

Name: name
Concepticon_Definition: Any word or phrase which designates a particular person, place, class or thing.
Example_Context: What is your name?

Name: burn
Description: Intransitive verb, not transitive.  Most generic equivalent of 'combust' meaning.
Concepticon_Definition: To put fire on something or to be on fire.
Example_Context: The wood is burning in the fire.

Name: tie
Description: The verb '(to) tie', not the noun.
Concepticon_Definition: To establish connection between two or more things.
Example_Context: He tied the two sticks together.

Name: run
Concepticon_Definition: To move quickly by alternately making a short jump off of either foot.
Example_Context: Can you run fast?

Name: hit
Description: The verb '(to) hit', not the noun for a blow or strike.
Concepticon_Definition: To give one blow or more with a swift movement.
Example_Context: He hit the ball with the stick.

Name: back
Description: The noun, part of the human body, not the English adjective or adverb 'back'.
Concepticon_Definition: The rear of body, especially the part between the neck and the end of the spine and opposite the chest and belly.
Example_Context: I fell over and now my back hurts.

Name: yellow
Concepticon_Definition: Having the colour of a yolk, a lemon or gold.
Example_Context: Egg yolk is yellow

Name: white
Concepticon_Definition: Bright and colourless; reflecting equal quantities of all frequencies of visible light.
Example_Context: There is a white cloud in the sky.

Name: water
Concepticon_Definition: Common liquid (H₂O) which forms rain, rivers, the sea, etc., and which makes up a large part of the bodies of organisms.
Example_Context: She was thirsty, so she drank some water.

Name: heart
Concepticon_Definition: A muscular organ that pumps blood through the body.
Example_Context: His heart was beating fast.

Name: tongue
Concepticon_Definition: The flexible muscular organ in the mouth that is used to move food around, for tasting and that is moved into various positions to modify the flow of air from the lungs in order to produce different sounds.
Example_Context: He stuck his tongue out.

Name: sun
Concepticon_Definition: The particular star at the centre of our solar system, from which the Earth gets light and heat.
Example_Context: During the day, the sun is in the sky; at night, it's not.

Name: skin
Concepticon_Definition: The tissue forming the outer covering of the vertebrate body: it consists of two layers, the outermost of which may be covered with hair, scales, feathers, etc. It is mainly protective and sensory in function.
Example_Context: His skin was old and hard.

Name: moon
Concepticon_Definition: A natural satellite of a planet.
Example_Context: I saw the moon in the sky.

Name: meat
Concepticon_Definition: The edible flesh of animals, especially that of mammals.
Example_Context: What animal does this meat come from?

Name: louse
Concepticon_Definition: A small wingless parasitic insect of the order Phthiraptera that lives on humans, other mammals and birds.
Example_Context: I picked a louse from his hair.

Name: leaf
Concepticon_Definition: The main organ of photosynthesis and transpiration in higher plants, usually consisting of a flat green blade attached to the stem directly or by a stalk.
Example_Context: He picked a leaf from the tree.

Name: earth
Description: The material, not the planet.
Concepticon_Definition: The soft and loose material forming a great part of the Earth surface.
Example_Context: As he dug the hole, he threw out the earth.

Name: red
Concepticon_Definition: Having red as its colour.
Example_Context: Blood is red.

Name: foot
Concepticon_Definition: The part of a human’s body below the ankle that is used in order to stand and walk.
Example_Context: Her foot is injured so she cannot walk.

Name: eye
Concepticon_Definition: The organ that is sensitive to light, which it converts to electrical signals passed to the brain, by which means animals see.
Example_Context: She closed one eye.

Name: star
Concepticon_Definition: A luminous celestial body that is made from gases (particularly hydrogen and helium) and forms the shape of a sphere.
Example_Context: There were many stars in the night sky.

Name: ear
Concepticon_Definition: The organ of hearing, consisting of the pinna, auditory canal, eardrum, malleus, incus, stapes and cochlea.
Example_Context: One ear of his was bigger than the other ear.

Name: cold
Concepticon_Definition: Having a low temperature.
Example_Context: The rocks get hot during the day and cold at night.

Name: black
Concepticon_Definition: Dark and colourless; not reflecting visible light.
Example_Context: Charcoal is black.

Name: bark
Description: The noun for the 'bark' of a tree.  *Not* the verb for the barking of dogs!
Concepticon_Definition: The exterior covering of the trunk and branches of a tree.
Example_Context: He tore some bark off the tree.

Name: tooth
Concepticon_Definition: A hard, calcareous structure present in the mouth of many vertebrate animals, generally used for eating.
Example_Context: You can break a tooth if you bite on hard food.

Name: nose
Concepticon_Definition: The organ of the face used to breath and smell.
Example_Context: While fighting, he hit him on the nose.

Name: small
Concepticon_Definition: Not large or big; small in size.
Example_Context: This is a small stone. That is a big stone.

Name: mountain
Concepticon_Definition: A feature of the earth's surface that rises high above the base and has generally steep slopes and a relatively small summit area.
Example_Context: He started to climb the mountain.

Name: liver
Concepticon_Definition: A large organ in the body that stores and metabolizes nutrients, destroys toxins and produces bile. Responsible for thousands of biochemical reactions.
Example_Context: When he died they found that his liver was very swollen.

Name: rain
Concepticon_Definition: To fall from the clouds in drops of water.
Example_Context: I saw him standing in the rain.

Name: belly
Concepticon_Definition: The lower part of the front of the torso (or a comparable part of an animal), confined by the upper side by the midriff and the lowerside by the pelvis. Contains the intestines.
Example_Context: He punched him in the belly.

Name: mouth
Concepticon_Definition: Opening in the lower half of a human face which is used for food ingestion and articulation.
Example_Context: He put his fingers in his mouth.

Name: knee
Concepticon_Definition: In man, the joint in the middle part of the leg.
Example_Context: He put his hand on his knee.

Name: horn
Concepticon_Definition: A hard growth of keratin that protrudes from the top of the head of certain animals.
Example_Context: Some animals have horns. Humans do not.

Name: blood
Concepticon_Definition: A fluid connective tissue consisting of the plasma and cells that circulate in the blood vessels.
Example_Context: Blood is red.

Name: woman
Concepticon_Definition: An adult human member of the sex that produces ova and bears young.
Example_Context: I saw a man and a woman.

Name: bird
Concepticon_Definition: Any of the bipedal, warm-blooded vertebrates that lay eggs having wings which, for most species, enables them to fly.
Example_Context: What bird does this feather come from?

Name: dog
Concepticon_Definition: A common four-legged animal, especially kept by people as a pet or to hunt or guard things.
Example_Context: I would like to own a dog.

Name: long
Concepticon_Definition: Having much distance from one terminating point on an object or an area to another terminating point.
Example_Context: This is a long rope; that is a short rope.

Name: root
Concepticon_Definition: The absorbing and anchoring organ of a vascular plant; it bears neither leaves nor flowers and is usually subterranean.
Example_Context: You could see some of the roots of the tree above the ground.

Name: tree
Concepticon_Definition: Any large woody perennial plant with a distinct trunk giving rise to branches or leaves at some distance from the ground.
Example_Context: There is a tree beside the house.

Name: hand
Concepticon_Definition: That part of the fore limb below the forearm or wrist in primates (including humans).
Example_Context: He burned his hand.

Name: hot
Concepticon_Definition: Having a very high temperature.
Example_Context: The rocks get hot during the day and cold at night.

Name: good
Concepticon_Definition: Having desired or positive qualities.
Example_Context: That is a good idea.

Name: man
Description: Specifically an adult male, not the generic sense of 'person' or 'humankind'.
Concepticon_Definition: An adult human member of the sex that begets young by fertilizing ova.
Example_Context: I saw a man and a woman.

Name: tail
Concepticon_Definition: The appendage of an animal that is attached to its posterior and near the anus.
Example_Context: The dog wagged its tail.

Name: hair
Description: Hair of the head, not the body.  Of people, not of animals.
Concepticon_Definition: The hair on humans, usually on the head but also including the hair on the body.
Example_Context: She pulled him by his hair.
